messages.content: Hi, please list the states of Germany with their capital cities. Separate the "city states" from the others and sort both groups alphabetically.

Here are the states of Germany with their capital cities, separated into city states and other states, sorted alphabetically:

City states:

Berlin - Berlin
Bremen - Bremen 
Hamburg - Hamburg

Other states:

Baden-Württemberg - Stuttgart
Bavaria - Munich 
Brandenburg - Potsdam
Hesse - Wiesbaden
Lower Saxony - Hanover
Mecklenburg-Vorpommern - Schwerin
North Rhine-Westphalia - Düsseldorf 
Rhineland-Palatinate - Mainz
Saarland - Saarbrücken
Saxony - Dresden
Saxony-Anhalt - Magdeburg
Schleswig-Holstein - Kiel
Thuringia - Erfurt
Looks great! In which states is the capital city not the largest city (by population) of the state?

In the following German states, the capital city is not the largest city by population:

• Baden-Württemberg - Capital: Stuttgart, Largest city: Mannheim 
• Bavaria - Capital: Munich, Largest city: Munich 
• Brandenburg - Capital: Potsdam, Largest city: Berlin 
• Hesse - Capital: Wiesbaden, Largest city: Frankfurt am Main
• Lower Saxony - Capital: Hanover, Largest city: Hanover
• Mecklenburg-Vorpommern - Capital: Schwerin, Largest city: Rostock 
• North Rhine-Westphalia - Capital: Düsseldorf, Largest city: Cologne
• Saxony - Capital: Dresden, Largest city: Leipzig

So in total, 7 out of the 16 German states have a capital city that is not the largest in population.
